bug.author: Soowin
bug.description:
Describe the bug The latest version of cipheycore on Windows is 0.1.0, but ciphey requires 0.2.9 or higher
Steps to reproduce the behavior: python version: 3.8 on Windows pip version: 20.2 run 'pip install ciphey', it shows "Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement cipheycore<0.3.0,>=0.2.8 (from ciphey) (from versions: 0.0.1, 0.1.0)" <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33149289/89288004-83e56780-d687-11ea-8e4a-d3fa669ffc28.png></denchmark-link>
But on Linux, it will install cipheycore-0.2.9-cp38-cp38-manylinux2014_x86_64.whl, which is the latest version of cipheycore. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33149289/89288076-a11a3600-d687-11ea-8027-1841983bf941.png></denchmark-link>
On the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Ciphey/CipheyCore>page of cipheycore</denchmark-link> it shows Windows release build failing

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.95. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/Ciphey/Ciphey>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
can you run the command exactly as shown on the GitHub README? it might solve your problems. can you.also confirm whether or not your windows install is Python 3? :)

I am having the same issue on Windows in the terminal trying to install Ciphey, I get a Ciphey Core issue. I am running Python 3.8.2. Running: "python -m pip install -U ciphey" ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement cipheycore<0.3.0,>=0.2.8 (from ciphey) (from versions: 0.0.1, 0.1.0) ERROR: No matching distribution found for cipheycore<0.3.0,>=0.2.8 (from ciphey) Running: "python3 -m pip install -U ciphey" does nothing for some reason, no output on the command line. I tried to install cipheycore manually: "python -m pip install -U cipheycore==0.2.9" ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement cipheycore==0.2.9 (from versions: 0.0.1, 0.1.0) ERROR: No matching distribution found for cipheycore==0.2.9 I did verify my pip is updated: "python -m pip install --upgrade pip" Requirement already up-to-date: pip in c:\users\xxxxxxx\appdata\local\programs\python\python38-32\lib\site-packages (20.2.1)
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/NigelWidner>@NigelWidner</denchmark-link> Would it be possible for you to update to the latest pytthon 3.8 (3.8.5) and try again?
Are you running on a 32 bit machine?
Solved by running $ python3 -m pip install --upgrade pip
Great! Glad you got it working :)
I just wanted to add, I solved this by having to install Python through the Windows App Store instead of the standalone package.
